thread.section_title: Statistics Canada, The Daily: Travel and tourism
thread.title: Travel between Canada and other countries, May 2015
thread.title_full: Travel between Canada and other countries, May 2015

title: Travel between Canada and other countries, May 2015
text:
(monthly change) Source(s): CANSIM table 427-0005 . 
Travel to Canada, both from the United States and other countries, rose 2.5% to 2.3 million trips in May. Travel by residents of the United States to Canada increased 2.2%, primarily as a result of a 2.5% gain in overnight trips made by Americans. 
Travel from overseas countries increased 3.6% to 462,000 trips. Travel from Germany and Brazil to Canada represented the largest percentage increases, both up 13.3% in May. 
In the other direction, travel abroad by Canadian residents increased 1.5% from April to 4.9 million trips, primarily due to a 2.0% gain in same-day car trips by Canadians to the United States. 
The number of trips made by Canadian residents to overseas countries increased 3.1% to 962,000 trips. Travel between Canada and other countries – Seasonally adjusted Note to readers Monthly data are seasonally adjusted. For more information on seasonal adjustment, see Seasonally adjusted data – Frequently asked questions . Products 
The May 2015 issue of International Travel: Advance Information , Vol. 31, no. 5 ( Catalogue number 66-001-P ), is now available from the Browse by key resource module of our website under Publications . Contact information
